item.title: AWS BedRock - Converse API - A single endpoint for all models ?
item.description: Amazon Bedrock is a fully managed service that makes high-performing foundation models (FMs) from leading AI startups and Amazon available for your use through a unified API. You can choose from a wide range of foundation models to find the model that is best suited for your use case. Amazon Bedrock also offers a broad set of capabilities to build generative AI applications with security, privacy, and responsible AI. With Amazon Bedrock, you can easily experiment with and evaluate top foundation models for your use cases, privately customize them with your data using techniques such as fine-tuning and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), and build agents that execute tasks using your enterprise systems and data sources.

item.title: Essential Database Design: Five Fields Every Table Must Have
item.description: Essential Fields Be it relational or not, every table should have these 5 fields: created_at (default now()) updated_at (default now()) deleted_at (default null) created_by (not null) updated_by (not null) Just to be clear, every table should have these 5 fields and not must. Adding these fields have other side-effects such as bloat, performance and disk size. But, if you’re having these problems, i hope you’re profitable. Why should you include this fields ?

item.title: Speeding up the GPT - KV cache
item.description: The common optimization trick for speeding up transformer inference is KV caching 1 2. This technique is so prominent that huggingface library has use_cache flag is enabled by default 6. A few days ago, I read an awesome blog post on GPT in 60 Lines of NumPy. So, i thought, why not extend it to use the KV cache technique? So, letâ€™s roll up our sleeves and start working on it.

item.title: LC contest problems summary
item.description: Biweekly-66 (27th Nov, 2021) 2085. Count Common Words With One Occurrence Hint 1 Use hashmap (Counter) 2086. Minimum Number of Buckets Required to Collect Rainwater from Houses" Hint 1 First put the bucket at best place and the remove those covering home. Hint 2 Answer is (best bucket cnt + remaining house). Hint 3 Corner case: check for each house is coverable 2087. Minimum Cost Homecoming of a Robot in a Grid Hint djikstra will fail.

item.title: Hugo commands
item.description: run local server hugo server -D Create New Post hugo new content/posts/{post-name}.md Hugo build/export the site hugo -d ../becoming-the-unbeatable relative imports example: static\icons\favicon.png relative imports: icons\favicon.png fix for label image icon: small_icon.jpg instead of icon: small_icon.png github issue: https://github.com/adityatelange/hugo-PaperMod/issues/622
